title: Incredible home hides indoor exotic beach and floor filled with rare fish
text:

It looks like something from a fantasy film set but this home could be yours for a cool £2.85million.

The property, which was imported from Switzerland in 1882, boasts its own 24-carat bathroom and even a cinema room and fully stocked library.

With four-bedrooms, the five-storey home is right next to Hampton Court Palace, the former home of Henry VIII.

But it's the fully heated, indoor beach, with its own tonnes of sand that is truly incredible.

On the lower ground floor, the indoor beach also has a performance stage, seating areas and bespoke wine racks, which could be used to store hundreds of bottles of wine.

(Image: Rightmove/Savills)

(Image: Rightmove/Savills)

(Image: Rightmove/Savills)

Sunlight streams into the beach through huge sky lights and the cinema is hidden behind the wine storage.

Rightmove’s property expert Miles Shipside said: " Never before have I seen such a beautifully individual, luxurious and charismatic property bursting at the seams with such personality.

"This home epitomises the variety and quirkiness that Rightmove has to offer and the chalet’s price tag makes it a relative bargain.

"Every room features something extraordinary and it’s great that our users are able to look inside some of the world’s most interesting properties like this."

To get to the beach, visitors walk in through a lush oriental garden filled with seating areas and swing seats.

(Image: Rightmove/Savills)

(Image: Rightmove/Savills)

(Image: Rightmove/Savills)

And once inside, there is a grated metal floor above water filled with Koi Carp.

To get to a second seating area, there is an ornate bridge with rails made to look like Samurai swords.

On the first floor there is an Italian kitchen and breakfast room with FIVE fridges, two ovens, two microwaves and a steam oven.

A door made from Swarovski crystals separates the kitchen from the dining room, which has stunning views of the River Thames and an outdoor balcony.

A spiral staircase leads up to the second floor with a traditional library that can be packed wall to wall with books and a guest bedroom.

(Image: Rightmove/Savills)

(Image: Rightmove/Savills)

Japanese-style pod beds are in two more guest bedrooms at the front of the unusual home.

To add that extra bit of luxury, they come with a body massage system, fluorescent lighting and a TV.

The master bedroom covers the entire top floor of the property and it can be reached by a glass staircase.

It has its own balcony with stunning views acriss the Thams and has TWO free-standing baths, a rainfall shower and hand basins made from marble and 24-carat gold.

The whole home is fitted with its own sound system and there are even private mooring facilities.
